meanings.definition: One of a group of isomers that differ only in the spatial arrangement of atoms.
meanings.sent1: In chemistry class, we learned about a stereoisomer and how its atoms are arranged differently.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study stereoisomers to understand how the arrangement of atoms affects a molecule's properties.
meanings.sent3: The stereoisomer walked into the party and everyone noticed its unique spatial arrangement.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two friends was like that of stereoisomers, always close but never overlapping.
meanings.sent5: The stereoisomer puzzle was challenging, requiring precise placement of each atom.

meanings.definition: A molecule that has the same molecular formula as another molecule but differs in the arrangement of atoms in space.
meanings.sent1: When studying organic chemistry, we discussed how a stereoisomer can have the same formula but a different spatial arrangement.
meanings.sent2: The scientist compared the two molecules, noting the unique spatial arrangement of each stereoisomer.
meanings.sent3: The stereoisomer and its identical twin molecule had a funny mix-up due to their different spatial arrangements.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a jumbled stereoisomer, each idea perfectly aligned but in a different order.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset reflected the complexity of the stereoisomer's spatial arrangement.
